hypothesis_content.title: SOL Volatility Regime Transition Signal
hypothesis_content.statement: When SOL experiences a >15% single-day price drop with volume >200% of 20-day average during a NEUTRAL regime, and its 5-day implied volatility (derivatives) spikes to >120% annualized, selling volatility via short-dated options will be profitable over the next 7 days as volatility compresses.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Large single-day drops in major altcoins during neutral regimes often represent panic selling rather than structural breakdowns. Implied volatility spikes to extreme levels that typically compress quickly once panic subsides, creating premium-selling opportunities.
entry_conditions: SOL price remains above 50-day SMA (maintains bull structure)

exit_conditions.stop_loss: SOL price drops another >10% from entry

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Volatility remains elevated or expands further while price continues declining (>55% of occurrences).
